DOC.brief_summary: This study was conducted to evaluate results of slanted recession of the lateral rectus muscle for intermittent exotropia with convergence weakness
DOC.brief_title: Early Results of Slanted Recession of the Lateral Rectus Muscle for Intermittent Exotropia With Convergence Weakness
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective study included 31 patients who underwent slanted lateral rectus muscle recession for intermittent exotropia with convergence weakness. Measurements of preoperative and postoperative deviation angle, stereopsis was performed.
DOC.criteria: Patients with intermittent exotropia greater at near than at distance by 10 prism diopters or more Patients with follow up duration greater than 6 months Patients with previous ocular or strabismus surgery Patients with ocular or neurologic pathologic conditions Follow up duration less than 6 months
